title: Citi Ranked Most Attractive Employer Among Foreign Banks in China
summary: Shanghai, China - Citi was ranked by business students as the employer of choice among foreign banks in China, according to the latest IDEAL survey. The survey was conducted by Globe Biweekly Magazine and Universum, a leading human resources company.
tag-1: Citi Ranked Most Attractive Employer Among Foreign Banks in China
tag-2: Shanghai, China – Citi was ranked by business students as the employer of choice among foreign banks in China, according to the latest IDEAL survey. The survey was conducted by Globe Biweekly Magazine and Universum, a leading human resources company.
tag-3: Ranked first among foreign banks and third overall, the result is a significant improvement for Citi from last year's seventh overall ranking.
tag-4: Andrew Au, Chief Executive Officer, Citi China, said, "This is an important validation of our ongoing efforts to be a respected leader in China's financial services sector and to be an organization that is able to attract and retain the best talent available. I am delighted that Citi is a highly sought-after employer among Chinese business students, and this is a reflection of our company's strengths, progress and vision for our business in China."
tag-5: The IDEAL survey, conducted annually since 2006, is intended to reveal students' perceptions of organizations in China as employers. Almost 130,000 individual evaluations were conducted by Universum from November 2011 and March 2012. Of that, more than 40,000 students from 90 leading universities were surveyed.
tag-6: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-8: Citi China  Citi first established an office in China on May 15, 1902, in Shanghai. In April 2007, Citi was among the first international banks to locally incorporate in China. Citi's locally incorporated entity is known as Citibank (China) Co Ltd, which is wholly owned by Citibank N.A. Today Citi is a leading international bank in China, and has thirteen corporate bank branches - in Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Tianjin, Chengdu, Hangzhou, Dalian, Chongqing, Guiyang, Nanjing, Changsha and Wuxi- and forty-nine consumer bank outlets. With operations in more than 160 countries around the world, Citi is the most global of all international banks in China.
